DOCNAME: CASE OF KOZYYAKOVA AND GUREYEV v. RUSSIA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and lived in GPE .

CARDINAL . At the relevant time the applicants were in receipt of a pension from the pension authority ( “ the authority ” , PERSON по социальной защите населения администрации Железнодорожного района г. PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . It appears that in DATE and DATE there were delays in payment of their pension and in DATE the applicants brought a court claim against the authority in this connection .

CARDINAL . By judgments of CARDINAL and DATE ORG of the town of GPE granted the applicants ' claims and ordered the authority to pay the first applicant MONEY ( RUR – MONEY ) in damages . The second applicant was granted a compensation of RUR CARDINAL ( approximately CARDINAL euros ) .
CARDINAL . The judgments came into force on CARDINAL and DATE respectively .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG issued the writs of enforcement and directed them to the bailiffs for enforcement .
CARDINAL . According to the applicants , in DATE the bailiffs returned the writs without enforcement with reference to the lack of funds .
CARDINAL . It appears that the court award in respect of the first applicant was enforced on DATE . As regards the second applicant , the award was received on DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , the awards in respect of both applicants were enforced in full on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE provides that a bailiff 's order on the institution of enforcement proceedings shall fix a time - limit for the defendant 's voluntary compliance with the writ of execution . The time - limit can not exceed DATE . The bailiff shall also warn the defendant that coercive action will follow , should the defendant fail to comply within the time - limit .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of the LAW , the enforcement proceedings should be completed within DATE upon receipt of the writ of enforcement by the bailiff .
